tweet:
Today marks the 100th B-Day of baseball legend Jackie Roosevelt Robinson of Cairo, GA! #GA02 
His legacy lives on through his groundbreaking career in baseball (as the 1st AA to break the Major League’s color barrier), heroic civil rights activism, & brave service to our country. pic.twitter.com/xx6pRjGJTw

I am a proud supporter of the Social Security 2100 Act. Social Security lifts more Americans out of poverty than any other program and must be kept strong for the future! #Secure2100 pic.twitter.com/u34yKDYzcQ

& debate on border control security measures. In the meantime, I stand ready to do all I can to undo this damaging shutdown & give relief to the selfless 800,000 federal workers & all other Americans who have been hurt from this shutdown.

I was relieved to hear that @POTUS will sign legislation to reopen the gov't for 3 weeks. This will allow fed workers & contractors to be paid & provide Americans w/ the services to which they have been deprived. For 35 days we've asked to reopen the gov't, pay our workers,

Let’s reopen the government, pay our federal workers, & get them back to work for their sake, their family’s sake, & the sake of all American people. Let’s do our job so they can do theirs. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bishop-let-s-do-our-job-so-they-can-do-theirs …

I was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of former Congressman Jack Brinkley. He was a great representative for SWGA & he served his community w/ distinction. Our nation has lost an exceptional public servant, & I have lost a trusted friend & mentor. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/bishop-statement-on-the-passing-of-former-south-georgia-congressman-jack …

Today, the House will vote to reopen the gov’t so federal workers do not miss their 2nd paycheck this Friday. Let’s get them back to work while we negotiate border security & immigration policy in a bipartisan fashion as the gov’t was meant to work!
Today we pay homage to the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. He said it best, “Life’s most persistent and urgent question is: what are you doing for others?”

My office has compiled a list of FAQs to help guide you through the government shutdown.  https://tinyurl.com/y79qg7n9  If you have any additional questions, feel free to contact my offices. https://bishop.house.gov/contact/offices

Nat. disasters devastated our communities & they're in need of recovery. This bill will provide them w/ the tools they need to repair & rebuild. I urge the Senate to pass this bill & send it to the Pres. so we can reopen the gov & help the ppl in need. https://tinyurl.com/y8k66rxu

Hurricane Michael devastated SWGA. Producers suffered near 100% crop losses & the pecan, peanut, cotton, vegetable, & poultry industries experienced significant damages. I thank @AustinScottGA08 & the bipartisan cosponsors for this solution. https://tinyurl.com/yb2hjoqu

Gifted w/ the genius to articulate the hopes & aspirations of the masses in their quest for freedom, no man has done more to bring dignity to the common man than Rev. Dr. MLK, Jr. 

Happy Birthday Dr. King, you continue to inspire us every day. #MLK90 pic.twitter.com/PUF5aW5C73

The shutdown becomes more precarious every day that it continues. We all fall victim to this shutdown. I urge my Senate colleagues to vote on this legislation & send it to the President’s desk & end this shutdown. https://goo.gl/1zRahj

“…millions of Americans will not be able to have their tax returns processed so they can receive the refunds on which they rely to make purchases, pay bills and school tuition.” Watch more here ->  https://tinyurl.com/ycxhdxad

The Ocmulgee Mounds is a true cultural & archaeological treasure to GA & the nation. I am confident that this important bipartisan legislation will strengthen the current Ocmulgee National Monument & bolster the economy & cultural life of GA & beyond. https://tinyurl.com/y7czqqbt

After Hurricane Michael devastated my constituents’ crops, several farmers received D-Snap. The admin’s cont’d shutdown puts D-Snap at risk & threatens the livelihood of farmers/families in GA02. @POTUS should reopen the gov’t before more damage is done.

It is vital that Congress addresses the needs of communities in Georgia and across the nation that are still rebuilding from Hurricane Michael & other recent disasters. I will continue my fight to pass a robust disaster relief bill that will help rebuild after Hurricane Michael. https://twitter.com/rollcall/status/1081252698249408512 …

The longer this shutdown continues over a border wall, the longer federal workers, farmers, & families will remain in uncertainty. It's Congress’ first & foremost duty to come together & govern responsibly for the American people & keep the government open & functioning. pic.twitter.com/kN4SmLjkmy

The Bipartisan Budget Act contains acceptable budget caps & suspends the debt limit so we can engage in a disciplined appropriations process, invest in our country, & grow the economy—while protecting the full faith & credit of the US. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/chairman-bishop-supports-bipartisan-budget-act …

I joined my fellow MFC co-chair, @CathyMcMorris, in addressing education for military children. I firmly believe that giving every child the same opportunity to reach their full potential will strengthen our military, improve our retention rates, & benefit our entire nation. pic.twitter.com/iJG42QXK4r

Thanks to a debris removal reimbursement grant from @fema, the City of Albany can fully focus on repairing & rebuilding areas impacted by Hurricane Michael. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-bishop-announces-2545-million-in-fema-disaster-recovery …

I’ve long supported American workers & was proud to support the #RaiseTheWageAct! This bill will give 43% of GA02 workers a major raise and stimulate the local economy. Americans work hard & should be able to support themselves & their families. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-bishop-praises-passage-of-raise-the-wage-act …

I am extremely pleased with the FY2020 NDAA. This bill cements a robust national defense while strengthening our commitment to support our troops in every way possible. I am positive that this will keep our military the best in the world. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-bishop-applauds-house-passage-of-national-defense …

This week, as we remember the devastating flood of 1994 that took 31 lives, evacuated 40,000+ people, & destroyed communities, let us also remember the generosity & kindness our neighbors showed one another & keep that spirit alive as we honor those we lost 25 years ago. pic.twitter.com/FePNhKKlyO
Wishing a safe and happy Fourth of July to all! Happy #IndependenceDay! pic.twitter.com/lIOex8FzLF

OTD in 1964, the Civil Rights Act was signed into law by Pres. LBJ. This monumental legislation prohibited segregation in public places & discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. Fifty-five years later, the fight for equality continues. pic.twitter.com/ZIkBtXkCfU

The CR that was put before the House was an insufficient response to the needs of the American people. We must meet the needs of my constituents & Americans rebuilding from recent disasters & we must pass a funding bill that would avoid a gov shutdown.  https://goo.gl/gWUSRG
Congratulations to @downindecatur, @LCHSTrojans, & all #GA02 teams represented in the 2018-2019 @OfficialGHSA State Football Championships!

I’m disappointed w/ the closure of Virginia College & its campuses in Columbus & Macon. I've reached out to @usedgov & @DeptVetAffairs & will continue to help the impacted students.

I am pleased w/ the Head Start grant awarded to the Macon-Bibb County Economic Opportunity Council, Inc. This grant will provide educational resources to disadvantaged children & families to combat economic & social barriers throughout Macon-Bibb county. https://goo.gl/8QUKjz
153 years ago today, Georgia became the 27th state to ratify the 13th Amendment, abolishing slavery in the United States.

I’m saddened to learn of the passing of President George H.W. Bush. The world lost a statesman, decorated Navy pilot, & dedicated public servant. He will be remembered for his service & distinguished legacy. My heartfelt condolences go to the Bush family during this time.

ATTENTION SENIORS: Medicare open enrollment period ends on December 7. Please take advantage of free federal and state resources like Medicare Plan Finder & GeorgiaCares to find SAVINGS ON HEALTH INSURANCE PLANS AND PRESCRIPTION MEDICATION.

This CR will help w/ funding for the census & a 3.1% pay raise for service members. I support this CR & supported the last one, & I urge the Senate to pass the approps bills forthwith & get them to the Pres. to prevent another govt shutdown. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/chairman-bishop-supports-continuing-resolution-0 …

Yesterday, I joined my CBC colleagues in sending a letter to @SecretarySonny addressing our concerns about @USDA’s proposed rule to eliminate broad-based categorical eligibility in SNAP and the detrimental effects this rule may have. https://twitter.com/TheBlackCaucus/status/1196833554770083843 …

As we continue to celebrate #NativeAmericanHeritageMonth, let us also take the time to reflect and honor the significant history, accomplishments, and customs surrounding Native American communities and culture. pic.twitter.com/7vFNwUhVSN

I was humbled to present the Inaugural Medal of Bravery posthumously to Stormy, one of the first Marine Scout Dog teams to be deployed to Vietnam. Military canines are more important than ever in keeping our service members safe. Thank you for your service, Stormy. #militarydog pic.twitter.com/s5KU7GWOAz

Today, @usdaRMA announced it will continue to defer accrual of interest for 2019 crop year insurance premiums to help the wide swath of farmers and ranchers affected by extreme weather in 2019. https://twitter.com/usdaRMA/status/1195023879913164800 …

I’m proud to join my colleagues in this bipartisan and bicameral letter urging @USFWS to protect the livelihoods of agricultural producers from avian predators. https://twitter.com/JohnBoozman/status/1191748488037634049 …

The current treatment of migrant children & fams @ our border is unacceptable & inconsistent w/ our nation’s values. While the bill doesn’t satisfy everyone, I’m relieved that we came to a bipartisan consensus that is more reflective of American values. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/chairman-bishop-statement-on-the-passage-of-the-emergency-humanitarian …

I’m proud to support the 2nd bipartisan approps bill, which makes investments in our military fams, vets, rural communities, ag, public safety, infrastructure, clean air, & drinking water, as well as other areas. I hope it will quickly pass in the Senate. https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/chairman-bishop-statement-on-passage-of-fy20-funding-package-for …

The #VotingRightsAct of 1965 was a landmark law that prohibited racial discrimination in voting. Forty-eight yrs later, a portion of the act was ruled unconstitutional, leading to purged voter rolls, shortened early voting periods, & almost a thousand closures of polling places. pic.twitter.com/ohzTn6rBE4
Today, we recommit ourselves to working to free modern-day slaves around the world and honoring the efforts of those who fought so hard to steer our country to our highest ideals. #Juneteenth
Today marks 244 years of American soldiers defending the freedoms of our great nation. Happy Birthday to the oldest and largest of our Armed Forces, the @USArmy! #Hooah #ArmyBday

Earlier this week, I humbly accepted the Visionary Award from @fightblindness for introducing the Eye Bonds bill. There is so much promising research on treatments for blindness, but it sits on shelves because there isn’t money to advance it. More info  https://tinyurl.com/y3xehscv  pic.twitter.com/NdJHii8xAj

I look forward to @SecretarySonny & @USDA   distributing the disaster bill assistance to rural communities and farmers, so SW GA and the nation can get relief as soon as possible. pic.twitter.com/Ieo0TY2dMy

As Chair of the AG-RD-FDA Approps Subcommittee, I am extremely proud that our bill invests in America’s fundamental needs & rejects the Administration’s radical cuts. WATCH NOW, as I lead the @AppropsDems’ markup for the FY 2020 AG-RD-FDA approps bill, which provides $24.3 billion in funding, an increase of $1 billion, for food & nutrition programs, rural development, medical product safety, & much more.  https://youtu.be/jDwPAcZFlWg  pic.twitter.com/qzmk05TZQL

I am proud to announce that H.R. 2157 has passed the House and is on its way to @POTUS’ desk. I am thankful that Americans will finally receive disaster relief after months of waiting for the Administration and the Senate to stop playing politics.

I'm saddened to hear Rep. Conyers passed away. He was a champion for racial equality & changed Congress by co-founding the CBC. He was a powerful & effective legislator who never stopped fighting to improve our nation. https://tinyurl.com/y6kcu377

I'm sorry to hear that my longtime mentor & friend, Sen. Leroy Johnson, passed away. He was an inspiration to me and he motivated me to emulate his path to public service. I extend my sincere condolences to his family & all those who mourn the loss of this great trailblazer.

I'm saddened by the passing of my longtime friend & colleague, Elijah E. Cummings. America has lost a warrior who was committed to doing the right thing, regardless of politics. Vivian & I send our prayers & deepest condolences to his family & loved ones. https://tinyurl.com/yyh244nz
Medicare Open Enrollment has begun and only lasts for six weeks – October 15 to December 7. Don’t miss your chance to #GetCovered on  https://www.medicare.gov/  for 2020!

House-passed spending legislation invests in school lunch and breakfast programs to ensure our children have access to healthy, nutritious food. Tune in at 10 AM as @AppropsDems & I protect these vital programs. #WorldFoodDay https://youtu.be/4plj7XqRzB4

Hopefully cooler heads will prevail before the further use of force, provided that it's in consultation w/ Congress. Read my full statement on the Iran War Powers Res. here: https://bishop.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-bishop-supports-iran-war-powers-resolution …

While the Pres. has a duty to protect Americans from threats, by using military force when necessary, using it w/o a threat or Congressional approval is not only reckless, it is a violation of the Constitution.

Pay discrimination in the workplace is real. I extend my sincerest condolences to the family of Fmr. MS Sen. Thad Cochran. He was a true patriot whose significant contributions to agriculture & his state were well documented during his time in Congress through his roles as Chair of the Sen. Approps & Ag Committees.

Once again, Republicans have found a way to prolong the suffering of millions of Americans by blocking H.R. 2157. This disaster relief is vital to the livelihoods of millions and should not be used as a political pawn.

It’s disheartening to hear that the expected disaster relief, that was on its way to @POTUS’ desk, has been delayed yet again. However, I am hopeful that the House will pass this vital piece of legislation next week!

I applaud the Senate for finally passing H.R. 2157! I look forward to the House passing & @POTUS signing this essential bill to provide much-needed relief for all those directly affected by Hurricane Michael and other natural disasters across the country.

"What happens to a dream deferred?
Does it dry up
like a raisin in the sun?
Or fester like a sore—
And then run?
Does it stink like rotten meat?
Or crust & sugar over—
like a syrupy sweet?
Maybe it just sags
like a heavy load.
Or does it explode?"
 
- Langston Hughes, Harlem #BHM pic.twitter.com/sQp2usvfO5
